message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.IT 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper primarily deals with the deployment and scaling of virtual network functions (VNFs) to provide network services, which falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture. 
2. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper discusses the placement of VNFs across geo-distributed datacenters, which involves distributed computing and resource allocation. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes an online algorithm for dynamic VNF placement, which can be considered as a control problem in systems and control. 
4. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The paper uses a regularization-based approach from online learning literature to convert the offline optimal deployment problem into a sequence of one-shot regularized problems, which involves machine learning techniques. 
5. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper deals with the optimization of VNF placement for operational cost minimization, which can be considered as an information theory problem.
